comment.author: 63191264@N00
comment._content:
Best match;
John Thompson [d.17 Jan 1915] Rgt No.1007
The CWGC website records 
Thompson John
Argyle & Sutherland Higlanders
Age23
Date of Death 17th January 1915
Son of the late James and Archina Thompson, born at Stirling.
Commemorated on panel 42 & 44 Ypres (Menin Gate) Memorial
From Ancesty.com [which seems to have a problem with information from Scotland for some rubbish reason [get a grip, Scotland]] The 1901 census records him as a 9 year old child living with his parents James [aged 47] and Archina [aged 43], his older sisters Archina [aged 13] and his younger sisters Janet [aged 7] and Ivy [aged 5] at Manor Street, Falkirk.

comment.author: 71217563@N07
comment._content: Excellent.  I came to the same conclusion.  Difficult name to research for sure.

comment.author: 31324280@N02
comment._content: According to the Scottish National War Memorial he has an 'informal will from Pay Book" dated 23 Dec 1914 viewable in the Scottish National Archives.

comment.author: 38811045@N04
comment._content: Regimental number suggests he joined the A&S Highlanders around 29th July 1912.  Arrived in France & Flanders on the 19th December 1914.
